verses.name: Proverbs 11:1
verses.text: A false balance is abomination to the Lord: but a just weight is his delight.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:2
verses.text: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:3
verses.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:4
verses.text: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:5
verses.text: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:6
verses.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:7
verses.text: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:8
verses.text: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:9
verses.text: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:10
verses.text: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:11
verses.text: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:12
verses.text: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:13
verses.text: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:14
verses.text: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:15
verses.text: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:16
verses.text: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:17
verses.text: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:18
verses.text: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:19
verses.text: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:20
verses.text: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the Lord: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:21
verses.text: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:22
verses.text: As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:23
verses.text: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:24
verses.text: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:25
verses.text: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:26
verses.text: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:27
verses.text: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:28
verses.text: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:29
verses.text: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:30
verses.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:31
verses.text: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
